intro: Cancrinia lasiantha, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to survive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Cancrinia lasiantha plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
